title: 115_s62
content: The Act may be cited as the "January 8th National Memorial Act". The tragedy of January 8, 2011, at Congresswoman Gabrielle Gifford's ``Congress on Your Corner'' event resulted in the deaths of 6 people and injury of 13 others, including Congresswoman Giffords. It was the first assassination attempt on a Congressional Member during a constituent meeting, and Giffords sustained severe injuries. Gabe Zimmerman was the first Congressional staffer to be assassinated in the line of duty. The Arizona community and people worldwide came together in the aftermath. The Arizona community and people from around the world came together in the days following the tragedy to provide comfort and support at three memorial sites. Tucson's January 8th Memorial will honor those who died and showcase the response to the tragedy. The Tucson's January 8th Memorial will pay tribute to those who died and highlight the local, national, and international response to the tragedy. It will serve as a place for visitors to learn about the resilience of the community and the durability of democracy in the United States. The January 8th National Memorial will honor those who died and showcase the response to the tragedy, serving as a symbol of community resilience and democracy in the United States. The January 8th National Memorial, established by the Secretary of the Interior, will be affiliated with the National Park System once the Foundation complies with requirements. The Memorial will not be established until the Secretary certifies in a written report to the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. The Memorial will be managed by the Foundation, which must establish a trust fund for donations and the Memorial's construction, operation, maintenance, and management. The Memorial will consist of the designated "Memorial Boundary" area on the map and will cease to be part of the National Park System if the Foundation does not comply with requirements. The Foundation will manage the Memorial, responsible for its construction, operation, maintenance, and management. The Memorial will cease to be part of the National Park System if the Foundation fails to comply with requirements. The Secretary may provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the Foundation for financial assistance with marketing. The Secretary is limited in acquiring property or using Federal funds. The Secretary may provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the Foundation for marketing the Memorial. The Secretary is limited in acquiring property or using Federal funds for the Memorial's construction, operation, maintenance, or management. A general management plan will be developed by the Secretary in consultation with the Foundation. The Secretary will provide a copy of the completed general management plan to the House Committee on Natural Resources and the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources within 3 years of funds being available for the Act or the Memorial's establishment.
